title: 104_hr907
content: Federal retirement provisions for members of Congress and congressional employees are outlined in Section 1. The Congressional Annuity Reform Act of 1995 amends Section 8340(g)(1) of title 5, United States Code, relating to the maximum annuity allowable. It specifies changes regarding the final pay of the Member for whom the annuity is paid. The Congressional Annuity Reform Act of 1995 makes changes to the computation of annuities for Members of Congress and Congressional employees under CSRS and FERS, including adjustments to contribution rates. The Congressional Annuity Reform Act of 1995 amends the computation of annuities for Members of Congress and Congressional employees under CSRS and FERS, including changes to contribution rates. The Congressional Annuity Reform Act of 1995 amends annuity computation for Members of Congress and Congressional employees under CSRS and FERS, including changes to contribution rates. Effective December 31, 1969, the Act applies to annuities before and after its effective date. The Congressional Annuity Reform Act of 1995 amends annuity computation for Members of Congress and Congressional employees under CSRS and FERS, including changes to contribution rates. Effective December 31, 1969, the Act applies to annuities before and after its effective date, with modifications to Member service requirements. The Congressional Annuity Reform Act of 1995 amends annuity computation for Members of Congress and Congressional employees under CSRS and FERS, including changes to contribution rates. Effective December 31, 1969, the Act applies to annuities before and after its effective date, with modifications to Member service requirements. The Act also includes provisions for annuities before and after the effective date of the Congressional Annuity Reform Act of 1995. The Congressional Annuity Reform Act of 1995 modifies annuity computation for Members of Congress and Congressional employees under CSRS and FERS. It includes changes to contribution rates and service requirements. Amendments to FERS section 8422(a)(2) involve redefining employees and Members, excluding certain categories like law enforcement officers and Congressional employees. Administrative regulations are to be determined by the Secretary of the Senate and the Clerk of the House of Representatives. The Clerk of the House of Representatives, in consultation with the Office of Personnel Management, may prescribe regulations to carry out the provisions of this section and the amendments made by this section for applicable employees and Members of Congress. Effective dates for the amendments are specified, with subsection (a) taking effect on the date of the enactment of the Act, and other amendments applying to annuities commencing on or after November 6, 1996. An annuity for Members of Congress and congressional employees is computed based on service performed after November 6, 1996. Contributions rates are affected by the amendments made under subsection (d) starting on the first day of the first applicable date. The provisions of subsection (d) and (e) of the Act will take effect on specific dates: subsection (d) on the first day of the first applicable pay period after November 6, 1996, and subsection (e) on the date of the Act's enactment.
